item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, December 30, 2024 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Curl-Impersonate (118 points | 24 comments)
2. From Pegasus to Predator – The evolution of commercial spyware on iOS [video] (271 points | 91 comments)
3. MiceWine – run Windows applications and games on Android smartphones (65 points | 19 comments)

7. KAG – Knowledge Graph RAG Framework (144 points | 41 comments)
8. Pincites (YC S23) is hiring a founding engineer to build legal AI agents (Remote) ( | hide)
9. Passkey technology is elegant, but it's most definitely not usable security (47 points | 41 comments)
10. The Cody Computer (180 points | 21 comments)
11. Nikon reveals a lens that captures wide and telephoto images simultaneously (95 points | 59 comments)
12. 86Box: Emulator of x86-Based Machines (40 points | 15 comments)
13. PolyDye: Full color printer mod for Marlin 3D printers (88 points | 18 comments)
14. Where Is James Bond? Trapped in an Ugly Stalemate with Amazon (12 points | 1 comment)
15. The Zombocom Problem (193 points | 55 comments)
16. Wi-Fi and the Problem with Radar (DFS) (10 points | 2 comments)
17. Wishing Everyone a Happy Solsthelion (23 points | 17 comments)
18. Chess grandmaster Magnus Carlsen rejoins tournament he quit over wearing jeans (7 points | 3 comments)
19. Overloading the lambda abstraction in Haskell (2022) (43 points | 5 comments)
20. Apple and Meta go to war over interoperability vs. privacy (47 points | 48 comments)
21. Against the Hydraulic Analogy (26 points | 14 comments)
22. Build a working game of Tetris in Conway's Game of Life (2014) (224 points | 26 comments)
23. Neuters: Lightweight front end to Reuters News (77 points | 44 comments)
24. Issues with object-oriented programming in Guile (2022) (35 points | 4 comments)
25. The last Inca bridge master (126 points | 26 comments)
26. When Zig Is Safer and Faster Than Rust (45 points | 13 comments)
27. Trying to use Bluesky without getting burned again (239 points | 413 comments)
28. Archibald Low's ‘ruthlessly imaginative’ 1925 predictions come true, mostly (49 points | 18 comments)
29. Show HN: Chorus, a Mac app that lets you chat with a bunch of AIs at once (105 points | 54 comments)
30. Curl with Partial Files (23 points | 2 comments)
